description: Indicates if the file is REFRESHED/UPDATED/NOT APPLICABLE – literally “REFRESHED”, “UPDATED         ”  or“                                                     “
Literally “A”; indicates the end of the header record

RECORD INDICATOR TRANSFER TYPE; values include:
“A” = Incoming ACAT transfer
“B” = incoming Non-ACAT transfer
“C” = Incoming CIT transfer
“D” = Outgoing ACAT transfer
“E” = Outgoing Non-ACAT transfer
“F” = Outgoing CIT transfer
RECORD ID SEQUENCE NUMBER, begins with“00000001”
ACCOUNT NUMBER, including Office (3), Base Account (5), Check Digit (1)
INVESTMENT PROFESSIONAL (IP) NUMBER; NOTE: For three-character IP Numbers position 24 will be

RECORD TYPE; value includes:
“1” = Equity Asset record

ASSET TYPE ID; values include:
“C” = CUSIP
“M” = Memo

ASSET NUMBER; if Asset Type ID in position 026 is “M” then this field will be zeroes and asset description becomes description of memo; if asset number = 888888888, then asset is credit; if asset number = 999999999, then asset is debit
ASSET STATUS; see Appendix T for values

ACTUAL QUANTITY SIGN; values include:
“+” = Positive Quantity
“-” = Negative Quantity
“ ” = Not Applicable

MARKET VALUE SIGN; values include:
“+” = Debit Amount
“-” = Credit Amount
“
” = Not Applicable

CASH MARGIN INDICATOR; values include:
“C” = Cash
“M” = Margin
“S” = Short
NSCC METHOD OF DELIVERY CODE; see Appendix T for values

LONG/SHORT INDICATOR; values include:
“0” = Position Long
“1” = Position Short
Literally “X”; indicates the end of detail record 1
Indicates if the file is REFRESHED/UPDATED/NOT APPLICABLE – literally “REFRESHED”, “UPDATED”, or “ ”
Literally “Z”; indicates the end of the trailer record
